response.answer_text: Technology CAN DO WONDERS and will definitely help Managers improve their productivity. For example Artificial Intelligence is new era of revolution which can minimize human need to the maximum but can not replace them entirely. Technology can be a very strong tool to perform the following tasks for a Manager. Performance ManagementCustomer Relationship Management (CRM)Six Sigma (Six Sigma is a set of techniques and tools for process improvement)Ease Of Access To InformationCost Efficiency One of the main goals of technology includes making things cheaper and more affordable for people.Better Learning TechniquesMore efficiency and accuracy in less time and effortManagers can benefit from Technology to analyse performance reports of different areas in their domains

I would say that for certain jobs more likely than others. Take Uber for example, the drivers and their involvement with the company is essentially managed by Tech. Office managers in the more traditional sense are going to be harder to replace because they own relationships with people whether it is inside or outside the company. So unless the businesses become largely tech driven in the sense that human relationships are irrelevant, it will be difficult for tech to completely replace managers. Perhaps if society becomes more accustomed with tech ,which doesn’t seems so far off, it would seem more possible and maybe people would even be more compelled to replace manager with tech

Are you talking about creative managers? Or about those people who normally do nothing and forward emails and other information here and there? Second kinds of manager should be replaced by technology. And immediately. We don’t need them. But, the creative managers. We need more of them. I know it is very hard to manage any project and finish it successfully. The manager needs to manage; ExpectationTeam members including there hard core ego and conflicts.Changes and schedulesAnd worst unknown risks.And one more thing, not everyone can be manager as not everyone can be good teacher.

Technology helps managers, but I can’t imagine a situation when it replaces them completely. AI is great and I think that we should definitely use it to analyze data, to automate processes, and to do many other things… but not making decisions. Managers are often those who take care of teams in terms of transparency and a healthy atmosphere.
